intro: Sphaerotorrhiza, commonly known as the globe cress, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages. The plant is characterized by its compact, globular shape and small, white or yellow flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, round fruits called siliques. Sphaerotorrhiza is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
